comment.author: 30085166@N00
comment._content: Platt Adams (b.1885), his brother Ben Adams (b.1890), and Jim Duncan (b.1887) were American track & field athletes who competed in the 1912 Olympic games in Stockholm. Platt Adams won the silver medal in the standing long jump and the gold medal in the standing high jump: www.databaseolympics.com/players/playerpage.htm?ilkid=ADA... Ben Adams won the bronze medal in standing long jump and the silver medal in standing high jump: www.databaseolympics.com/players/playerpage.htm?ilkid=ADA... Olympics.com Jim Duncan won the bronze medal in the discus throw: www.databaseolympics.com/players/playerpage.htm?ilkid=DUN...; This photo looks as though it was taken on board a ship. It might have been taken on the occasion of the team's departure for Europe. The American Olympic team sailed for Stockholm on June 14, 1912, on board the USS Finland, which had been chartered for the voyage by the American Olympic Committee: en.wikipedia.org/wiki?title=USS_Finland

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content:
whyaduck:

Thanks for the more complete names of these athletes. We will expand the caption of this photograph to reflect these details.
